com.nutiteq.datasources.raster

Class StoredRasterDataSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.AbstractRasterDataSource
      • com.nutiteq.datasources.raster.StoredRasterDataSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.RasterDataSource

    public class StoredRasterDataSource
extends com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.AbstractRasterDataSource
    A raster data source class that uses the SDCard a source for the map tile data. The map data has to be in MGMaps format. The request are generated in this manner:

    path + name + "_" + zoom + "/" + tpfx + "_" + tpxy + ".mgm"

    For example if: path = "/london/", name = "OpenStreetMap"

    "/london/" + "OpenStreetMap" + "_" + "0" + "/" + "0" + "_" + "0" + ".mgm"

    Result: /london/OpenStreetMap_0/0_0.mgm

    • Constructor Detail

      • StoredRasterDataSource

        public StoredRasterDataSource(com.nutiteq.projections.Projection projection,
                      int tileSize,
                      int minZoom,
                      int maxZoom,
                      String name,
                      String path)
        Class constructor. Creates a new data source that uses a specified folder on the SDCard as a source for the tile data. The tile size is used to determine the naming convention for the tile files. Tiles that are out of the specified minimum / maximum zoom range are not downloaded. The id used should be unique to each rasterlayer, if two or more raster layers use the same id, they will also share the tiles in the cache. The map data must be in MGMaps format.
        Parameters:
        projection - the desired projection
        tileSize - the tile size in pixels
        minZoom - the minimum zoom
        maxZoom - the maximum zoom
        name - the name of the sub folders
        path - the path to the main map folder
